definition: if somebody does something anew, they do it again from the beginning or do it in a different way
good, kind or beautiful; like an angel
a person who catches fish (= goes angling) as a hobby
having no name; whose name you do not know
whose name is kept secret
difficult or too unpleasant to describe
a game played on ice, in which players slide heavy flat stones towards a mark
a person who is not English or British but who likes England or the UK very much
severe physical or mental pain, difficulty or unhappiness
a plant with seeds that have a strong sweet smell and taste
a person who writes annals
an official record of events or activities year by year; historical records
used in the title of academic journals
to destroy somebody/something/yourself completely
to defeat somebody/something completely
the act of somebody/something being completely destroyed
the complete defeat of somebody/something
describing or setting standards or rules of behaviour
not in or to any place
in a sudden and surprising way
to make no progress or have no success; to not enable somebody to make progress or have success
to have no successful result for somebody
a place that is a long way from other buildings, towns, etc.
far from; not at all
far from; not at all
impossible for anyone to find or see
to add notes to a book or text, giving explanations or comments
a person who introduces, or gives information about, programmes on the radio or television
a person who gives information about something in a station, an airport, etc., especially through a loudspeaker
a person who broadcasts at a sports event
to make somebody slightly angry
to make somebody uncomfortable or unable to relax
the feeling of being slightly angry
something that makes you slightly angry
slightly angry
making somebody feel slightly angry
a fixed amount of money paid to somebody each year, usually for the rest of their life
a type of insurance that pays a fixed amount of money to somebody each year
to state officially that something is not legally recognized
one of the two imaginary lines drawn around the world 23° 26′ north (the Tropic of Cancer) or south (the Tropic of Capricorn) of the equator
the area between the two tropics, which is the hottest part of the world
to put oil or water on somebody’s head or body as part of a religious ceremony
different from what is normal or expected
a short coat with a hood that is worn as protection against rain, wind and cold
a person who spends a lot of time learning facts or collecting things that most other people think are boring
having to explain your actions to somebody in authority over you
responsible for something and ready to accept punishment or criticism for it
that can be answered
showing or feeling opposition
a person, especially a boy or young man, who admires a particular person very much, or admires and enjoys something such as a type of music, product, or film very much
the feeling of dizziness and fear, and of losing your balance, that is caused in some people when they look down from a very high place
an African or Asian animal, like a deer, that runs very fast. There are many types of antelope.
a form of torture used to try to force somebody to give information by pouring water onto their face while making them lie on their back, so that they feel as if they are drowning
a wild animal of the cat family that has black spots and that runs very fast
a pile of earth formed by ants over their nests
the part of a flower at the top of a stamen that produces pollen
a small, thin male part in the middle of a flower that produces pollen and is made up of a stalk supporting an anther. The centre of each flower usually has several stamens.
a serious disease that affects sheep and cows and sometimes people, and can cause death
giving help or support to the main group of workers
used if there is a problem with the main piece of equipment
to make somebody worried or anxious
the process of making a wild animal used to living with or working for humans
the process of making a plant or crop suitable to grow for human use
the process of making somebody good at cooking, caring for a house, etc. and of making them enjoy home life
a substance or layer which is under something or on which something happens, for example the surface on which a living thing grows and feeds
advice, criticism or information about how good or useful something or somebody’s work is
the unpleasant noise produced by electrical equipment such as an amplifier when some of the power returns to the system
a situation that is disappointing because it happens at the end of something that was much more exciting, or because it is not as exciting as you expected
that is difficult to stop or control
not being able to control their behaviour
that makes you pay attention to it because it is so interesting and exciting
thinking too much about one particular person or thing, in a way that is not reasonable or normal
an area of high air pressure that produces calm weather conditions with clear skies
a chemical that is added to the water in the cooling system of cars and other vehicles to stop it from freezing
